original_text: You are the city's rulers, but you accept bribes. Then you do not judge people in a fair way. You priests teach people only if they pay you. 3: A priest was a man that God chose to serve him. You prophets speak about what will happen in future times. But you only speak if you receive money. But you still say that you trust the Lord. You say, ‘The Lord is with us, so nothing bad will happen to us.’ You are the city's rulers, but you accept bribes.
korean_text: 그들의 우두머리들은 뇌물을 위하여 재판하며 그들의 제사장은 삯을 위하여 교훈하며 그들의 선지자는 돈을 위하여 점을 치면서도 여호와를 의뢰하여 이르기를 여호와께서 우리 중에 계시지 아니하냐 재앙이 우리에게 임하지 아니하리라 하는도다

sentences.original_text: Then you do not judge people in a fair way
sentences.korean_translation: 그래서 너희는 사람들을 공정하게 판단하지 않는다

sentences.original_text: You priests teach people only if they pay you
sentences.korean_translation: 너희 제사장들은 돈을 줄 때만 사람들을 가르친다

sentences.original_text: A priest was a man that God chose to serve him
sentences.korean_translation: 제사장은 하나님이 택해서 섬기도록 한 사람이었다

sentences.original_text: You prophets speak about what will happen in future times
sentences.korean_translation: 너희 예언자들은 미래에 일어날 일에 대해 말한다

sentences.original_text: But you only speak if you receive money
sentences.korean_translation: 하지만 너희는 돈을 받을 때만 말한다

sentences.original_text: But you still say that you trust the Lord
sentences.korean_translation: 하지만 너희는 여전히 주님을 신뢰한다고 말한다

sentences.original_text: You say, 'The Lord is with us'
so nothing bad will happen to us
sentences.korean_translation: 그래서 아무 나쁜 일도 우리에게 일어나지 않을 것이다

sentences.original_text: You are the city's rulers, but you accept bribes
